page.title: 03EXMOOR FARMING
page.content: The roads to the farms are long, narrow twisty tracks. The farm buildings have a shelter belt of trees to protect them from the winds. The water supply is usually from springs. The farms are isolated from each other, although the car has reduced this isolation. Hill farming has no fixed hours of work and is best described as a way of life. The hill farmer is gradually being forced to change as more and more visitors come into the country-side and disrupt his life, by leaving gates open, parking in gateways and walking across his crops. Despite this, many farmers welcome the visitors, as it reduces the isolation and loneliness of their way of life.
